articles.headline: ‘Never Thought I Would Need It’: Americans Put Pride Aside to Seek Aid
articles.snippet: With coronavirus-related job losses, many workers are reluctantly seeking charity and unemployment benefits for the first time in their lives.
articles.abstract: With coronavirus-related job losses, many workers are reluctantly seeking charity and unemployment benefits for the first time in their lives.
articles.lead_paragraph: The cars arrived at the food bank in southern Dallas in a stream — a minivan, a Chevrolet Tahoe, a sedan with a busted window, a Jaguar of unclear vintage. Inside the vehicles sat people who scarcely could believe they needed to be there.

articles.headline: Coronavirus Battle Creates a Global ‘Free-for-All’ to Find Masks
articles.snippet: Traders scour factories and warehouses, find planes and pilots and look for buyers as hospitals and governments beg for protective gear.
articles.abstract: Traders scour factories and warehouses, find planes and pilots and look for buyers as hospitals and governments beg for protective gear.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI — Million-dollar wire transfers to strangers. Rumors of hidden supplies in forgotten warehouses. Wheeler-dealers trying to talk regulators and customs officials into letting that one precious shipment through.

articles.headline: Covid-19 Changed How the World Does Science, Together
articles.snippet: Never before, scientists say, have so many of the world’s researchers focused so urgently on a single topic. Nearly all other research has ground to a halt.
articles.abstract: Never before, scientists say, have so many of the world’s researchers focused so urgently on a single topic. Nearly all other research has ground to a halt.
articles.lead_paragraph: Using flag-draped memes and military terminology, the Trump administration and its Chinese counterparts have cast coronavirus research as national imperatives, sparking talk of a biotech arms race.
articles.byline: By Matt Apuzzo and David D. Kirkpatrick

articles.headline: Why the Global Recession Could Last a Long Time
articles.snippet: Fears are growing that the worldwide economic downturn could be especially deep and lengthy, with recovery limited by continued anxiety.
articles.abstract: Fears are growing that the worldwide economic downturn could be especially deep and lengthy, with recovery limited by continued anxiety.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — The world is almost certainly ensnared in a devastating recession delivered by the coronavirus pandemic.

articles.headline: Start-Ups Are Pummeled in the ‘Great Unwinding’
articles.snippet: Dozens have laid off thousands, slashed costs and changed their businesses to try to survive the pandemic. All that may not work.
articles.abstract: Dozens have laid off thousands, slashed costs and changed their businesses to try to survive the pandemic. All that may not work.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — After a crush of travel cancellations in March, WanderJaunt, a short-term home rental start-up in San Francisco, laid off 56 of its 240 employees last week.
